alert.note: Alert for Sheridan Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 05 at 2:46PM MST until January 07 at 6:00AM MST by NWS Billings
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Extended period of bitter cold, periods of snow and dangerously cold wind chills. Snow amounts on Thursday will be from 2 to 4 inches. * WHERE...South central Montana, as well as the Sheridan Foothills in Wyoming. * WHEN...Until 6 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Periods of light snow can be expected tonight with light accumulations. Heavier snowfall will occur Thursday and taper off Thursday night. The snow on Thursday will affect the morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tonight will be very cold with lows in the teens and 20s below zero. It will be a little warmer on Thursday. Wind chills of 20 to 40 below can be expected through the period. Wind chills this cold can cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. For the latest road conditions, call 5 1 1. Additional graphics for this hazard can be found at http://www.weather.gov/billings
